Tasks.Task Description: Extend your on-premises networks into the Microsoft cloud over a private connection with the help of a connectivity provider. This connection offers more reliability, faster speeds, consistent latencies, and higher security than typical connections over the Internet.
Create an ExpressRoute circuit to establish a private connection between your on-premises infrastructure and Microsoft datacenters.
Set up routing for your ExpressRoute circuit to ensure proper data flow between your on-premises network and Azure services.
Link a virtual network (VNet) to your ExpressRoute circuit to enable communication between your Azure resources and on-premises network.
Use ExpressRoute Fast Path to access your Azure Large Instances servers from anywhere, including Azure VMs and on-premises.
Ensure that all prerequisites are met before setting up ExpressRoute, including having an Azure subscription and establishing physical connectivity with an ExpressRoute partner.
Evaluate and implement network security measures such as virtual networks, firewalls, and threat protection for your ExpressRoute setup.
Customize your metrics and create a Connection Monitor to keep track of your ExpressRoute connection's performance and health.
Learn about different ExpressRoute connectivity models to choose the best one for your network setup.
Look for an ExpressRoute connectivity provider that meets your requirements and review their peering locations.
Ensure high availability by setting up a pair of ExpressRoute circuits, each terminated in a different router.
Enable ExpressRoute Premium to extend connectivity across geopolitical boundaries and for higher bandwidth requirements.
Use ExpressRoute Direct for dual 100-Gbps connectivity and physical isolation for regulated industries.
Refer to the ExpressRoute FAQ for common questions and additional information about the service.
Configure Network Insights to monitor and manage your ExpressRoute connection effectively.
Ensure data protection by implementing in-transit encryption, encryption at rest, and data discovery and classification.
Implement access control measures such as object-level security, row-level security, and dynamic data masking.
Set up authentication methods such as SQL login, Microsoft Entra ID, and multi-factor authentication (MFA).
Evaluate and implement network security requirements for client tools to access analytical compute and storage.
Implement threat protection measures such as threat detection, auditing, and vulnerability assessment.
